revised_title: Anatomy and Development of the Pelvic Girdle in Crocodilia and its Extinct Reptilian Allies
tldr: The author examines the bone structure and development of the pelvic girdle in crocodiles and their extinct reptilian allies, specifically focusing on the bone commonly regarded as the os pubis. The study reveals that the pubic cartilage in crocodiles does not contribute to the acetabulum and that the bone structure in these animals is distinct from other reptiles.
